entry.def: A bird's  nest is the home that it makes to lay its eggs in.

example.ex: I can see an eagle's nest on the rocks.
example.tran: 我能看到岩石上的鹰巢。

entry.def: When a bird nests somewhere, it builds a nest and settles there to lay its eggs.

example.ex: Some species may nest in close proximity to each other.
example.tran: 一些鸟类会彼此紧挨着筑巢。

entry.def: A nest is a home that a group of insects or other creatures make in order to live in and give birth to their young in.

example.ex: Some solitary bees make their nests in burrows in the soil.
example.tran: 一些独居蜂会把巢筑在田间的地洞里。

entry.def: You can refer to a place as your nest when it is your home or where you feel comfortable and relaxed.

example.ex: My wife seems to be building a nest of her own at Osborne House...
example.tran: 我夫人像是要把奥斯本庄园变成自己的安乐窝。

example.ex: The baby had been asleep in her nest of pink and white blankets.
example.tran: 婴儿睡在粉色和白色毛毯铺成的小窝里。

entry.tran: 老巢;窟;秘密窝点;(贼窟中的)一帮
entry.def: You can use nest to refer to a place where something bad is being done or to the people there who are doing it.

example.ex: ...Biarritz, notorious in those days as a nest of spies...
example.tran: 比亚里茨，那时候出了名的间谍老巢

example.ex: Are you telling me that you've got your own little nest of informers in the Police Department?
example.tran: 你是说你在警察局有一帮通风报信的？

entry.def: If you say that someone is feathering their nest, you mean that they are getting a lot of money out of something, so that they can lead a comfortable life.

example.ex: Mary's much more interested in doing things for other people than feathering her own nest.
example.tran: 相比追逐私利，玛丽更乐意帮助他人。

entry.def: When children fly the nest, they leave their parents' home to live on their own.

example.ex: When their children had flown the nest, he and his wife moved to a thatched cottage in Dorset.
example.tran: 孩子们独立生活后，他和妻子搬到多塞特的茅草屋去住了。

auth_sentence.content: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their nesting patterns gave rise to the term rookery.

auth_sentence.content: Nesting is colonial, but individual birds are monogamous.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nesting is colonial, but individual birds are monogamous.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nesting is colonial, but individual birds are monogamous.

auth_sentence.content: Introduced plants have also altered and restricted the nesting habitat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Introduced plants have also altered and restricted the nesting habitat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Introduced plants have also altered and restricted the nesting habitat.
